title: [Large-Scale] Elementary Mathematics Information Literacy Education for Real-World Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic digital device utilization skills
context.additional_context: A professional development course for elementary school teachers to improve information evaluation and utilization skills in math instruction. Conducts task-centered learning reflecting actual classroom situations

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish reliable from unreliable information sources in real mathematical problem situations with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners can critically analyze mathematics-related materials collected in digital environments and develop two or more teaching materials applicable to instruction.

Learners form teams of 2â€“3 peer teachers, select one real-life mathematics problem (e.g., budget allocation, space optimization), create presentation materials including a project plan, solution process, and results, deliver a 10-minute presentation, and achieve an "excellent" rating in at least two of three rubric criteria: problem definition clarity, appropriateness of mathematical modeling, and collaboration efficiency.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
